function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Uso de redes sociales para comunicar medidas gubernamentales durante la pandemia.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difusión de noticias falsas e información poco rigurosa","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uso de memes para difundir mensajes relacionados con la pandemia.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Relacionar personajes populares con mensajes sobre la pandemia.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Estereotipos de género asociados a la distribución de roles en la sociedad durante la pandemia.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impacto positivo en el medio ambiente durante la pandemia y reflexión sobre el consumo.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"La sobreexposición a información exagerada sobre covid-19 en las redes sociales","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exacerbación de rasgos negativos en las redes sociales durante la pandemia","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uso inadecuado de las redes sociales durante la pandemia","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"La difusión rápida de información errónea a través de las redes sociales durante brotes de enfermedades","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Efectos negativos de las redes sociales en la pandemia del covid19","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"La infodemia en las redes sociales, que difunde información poco rigurosa y contribuye a sentimientos de paranoia y miedo.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uso libertino e irresponsable de las redes sociales generando pánico y jugando en contra de la lucha contra la pandemia.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Necesidad de fortalecer y expandir las redes sociales para evitar morbilidad y mortalidad humanas durante crisis.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Conducting observational studies during a pandemic may pose a risk of exposure to the virus for researchers and participants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of public databases and access to information about contagious diseases may lead to the inadvertent spread of misinformation or panic through social media.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Comunicación inefectiva en redes sociales respecto a la situación de la pandemia","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Desacuerdo y polarización en redes sociales sobre las acciones de las autoridades","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disseminação de informações falsas e receitas médicas não comprovadas através das redes sociais","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Maior propagação do pânico e ansiedade devido a conteúdo alarmista","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Desconfiança nas medidas governamentais devido às publicações falsas e alarmistas","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Propagation of panic-inducing content on social networks","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective communication of official guidelines and measures on social networks","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Dissemination of unverified medical information and false news on social media can contribute to panic and misinformation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Social media platforms can be used to incite panic and spread false information about the pandemic, contributing to public distrust and confusion.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mismanagement of crisis communication on social media can lead to ineffective dissemination of accurate information and exacerbate public fear and confusion.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Normalization of non-compliance with covid-19 measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate trust in science and media reporting","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of sustained compliance with public health measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Easing of restrictions leading to increased social gatherings","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Noncompliance with stay at home and social distancing measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of self-reported compliance data","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid changes in people’s behavior and attitudes","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the impact of political views on compliance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Resistance to authority and measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Political orientation not a predictor of compliance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with social distancing measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unemployment leading to economic and social consequences","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of social norm on compliance behavior","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequality in compliance due to practical limitations","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential decline in compliant behavior over time","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Short-term compliance due to low impact of costs and negative emotions","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Individual differences in compliance based on impulsiveness","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in achieving minimum certainty of punishment for violating covid-19 measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mixed results in the relationship between moral support for measures and compliant behavior","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Perception of personal costs not influencing compliance","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Negative emotions increasing compliance with stay-at-home measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large reductions in retail and recreational activities, as well as in the usage of public transit, and visits to workplaces","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"People meeting with friends and relatives outside of their direct household","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of clarity in covid-19 measures","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
